summary: Project to fix incorrect checkout duration calculation on Territories page (after date picker change) while keeping existing behavior unchanged.
architectural_notes: Backend checkout date is expected/stored as a Unix timestamp in seconds; frontend must convert to JavaScript Date before computing durations.
known_issues: Territories page 'Checked Out Duration' shows incorrect large values (e.g., hundreds of months) since date picker was added to Check Out Territory modal.

existing_features.title: Fix the "Checked Out Duration" calculation on the Territories page so it correctly computes the duration between the current (not-returned) checkout date and today using backend timestamps in seconds (with defensive handling for legacy nanoseconds/incorrect milliseconds values). Display the duration in whole months ("1 month", "3 months") when the duration is at least 1 month; otherwise display whole days ("15 days").

Ensure checkout dates are saved and returned as timestamps in seconds (not milliseconds and not nanoseconds) for territory checkout records created/updated via the Check Out Territory and Edit Checkout Record flows.

new_feature_requests.summary: Fix Territories 'Checked Out Duration' calculation and ensure checkout date saved as timestamp in seconds (not ms)

projectName: Fix Territories checked-out duration calculation and enforce checkout timestamps in seconds
